name: Resource Management in Try-catch
description:
In order to always ensure the closing of resources that are used within a try-catch statement,
Java introduced the try-with-resources statement. Using this is a best practice to avoid accidental
leaking of resources. Beginners might come across this when doing first exercises on reading files
and using I/O streams. They should be rewarded for using this pattern, as the code itself is way cleaner
and the alternative of not using it endangers them of forgetting to close the resources.
This perfume is a Solution Pattern, inspired by the "Try-with-resources should be used" Code Smell from SonarSource.
